skill.name: caam
skill.description: Coding Agent Account Manager - Sub-100ms account switching for AI coding CLIs with fixed-cost subscriptions. Vault profiles, isolated profiles for parallel sessions, smart rotation with health scoring, cooldown tracking, automatic failover, TUI dashboard. Go CLI.
skill.summary: Coding Agent Account Manager - Sub-100ms account switching for AI coding CLIs with fixed-cost subscr...
skill.author: Dicklesworthstone

security_audit.summary: This skill contains only documentation (SKILL.md) with no executable code. The actual Go CLI tool is hosted externally on GitHub. The documentation describes legitimate OAuth token management for AI coding subscriptions. No security concerns detected in the skill package itself.

content.value_statement: Managing multiple AI coding subscriptions is frustrating when you hit rate limits. CAAM switches accounts in sub-100ms by backing up and restoring OAuth tokens locally.
actual_capabilities: Back up and restore OAuth authentication files for Claude Code, Codex, and Gemini CLI
Switch between accounts in under 100 milliseconds
Smart rotation with health scoring and cooldown tracking
Isolated profiles for running multiple accounts simultaneously
Interactive TUI dashboard for visual profile management
Automatic failover when rate limits are hit
limitations: Does not work with API key authentication
OAuth tokens may contain machine-specific identifiers that prevent syncing across machines
Rate limits still apply per account; this only speeds up switching

use_cases.title: Avoid rate limit interruptions
use_cases.description: Hit a rate limit mid-flow and need to continue immediately without browser OAuth friction

use_cases.title: Manage work and personal accounts
use_cases.description: Switch between work and personal AI coding subscriptions instantly

use_cases.title: Run parallel AI sessions
use_cases.description: Run multiple AI accounts simultaneously in different terminals with full directory isolation

prompt_templates.title: Check active accounts
prompt_templates.scenario: See which account is currently active

prompt_templates.title: Switch accounts
prompt_templates.scenario: Switch to a different account instantly

prompt_templates.title: Auto-select best account
prompt_templates.scenario: Let the system pick the healthiest account

prompt_templates.title: Run with failover
prompt_templates.scenario: Run a command with automatic rate limit handling
prompt_templates.prompt: caam run claude -- explain this code

best_practices: Use actual email addresses as profile names for clarity
Backup current account before clearing and logging into a new one
Run caam status frequently to track which account is active
anti_patterns: Syncing the vault across multiple machines
Switching accounts while a session is running
Assuming rate limits are bypassed rather than handled faster

faq.question: Which AI coding tools does CAAM support?
faq.answer: CAAM supports Claude Code (Claude Max), Codex CLI (GPT Pro), and Gemini CLI (Google One AI Premium).

faq.question: How fast is account switching?
faq.answer: CAAM switches accounts in under 100 milliseconds by copying OAuth token files.

faq.question: Does CAAM bypass rate limits?
faq.answer: No. CAAM manages local auth files to speed up switching. Each account still respects its individual usage limits.

faq.question: Can I sync my accounts across machines?
faq.answer: No. OAuth tokens often contain machine-specific identifiers. Backup and restore separately on each machine.

faq.question: What is the difference between vault and isolated profiles?
faq.answer: Vault profiles swap auth in place for single-account use. Isolated profiles provide full directory isolation for running multiple accounts simultaneously.

faq.question: Is CAAM compatible with Claude Code on all platforms?
faq.answer: CAAM works on Linux and macOS where Claude Code, Codex, and Gemini CLI are supported. Check the GitHub repo for system requirements.
